intro: Boechera dispar, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. Boechera dispar is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
